newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares continue climb, end week on highs.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares continue climb, end week on highs.

text.p: Swedish shares continued climbing on Friday to close the week at a fifth consecutive high, aided by gains in market heavyweight Ericsson and a higher open in New York in afternoon trade.
The Stockholm general index rose 0.45 pct to 2,997.43 in fairly steady turnover of 5.96 billion crowns.
Brokers said interest in the market remained good ahead of the mid-year mark.
One of the most traded stocks of the day was telecoms major Ericsson which closed 0.5 higher at 313 crowns.
The drugs sector posted gains. The index rose 0.94 percent.

Pharmacia & Upjohn rose 5.5 to 264 crowns, staging a recovery after recent drops despite analysts telling Reuters that the company had been calling analysts saying market forecasts for the second quarter were too high.
Rival Astra closed 1.5 higher at 145 crowns.
"UBS buys have held up the level in Astra," a broker said.

The bank sector was the biggest gainer rising 1.73 percent. The mood was positive mood as the crown firmed and debt yields fell on the back of a statement from U.S. credit rating agency Moody's. The agency said the outlook for Sweden had improved over the past two years.
Handelsbanken rose eight to 244.5 crowns, Nordbanken gained seven to 254, S-E-Banken edged up 1.5 to 84.50 and Swedbank closed one higher at 168.
The forestry sector was weaker. The index fell 0.47 percent.
SCA said the market would not be ready for any increase in pulp prices until before the fourth quarter of 1997. SCA slipped 0.5 to 165.5 crowns.
